title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Health and Safety Engineers

content.rendered:
What is a Health and Safety Engineer?

Health and Safety Engineers use their knowledge of engineering and health to create systems that prevent injury and sickness.

Where does a Health and Safety Engineer work?

  • Manufacturing companies
  • Construction companies
  • Government 

How much does a Health and Safety Engineer make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Health and Safety Engineer is $66,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Health and Safety Engineers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Environmental health majors
  • Engineering majors
Search Health and Safety Engineer jobs

Health and Safety Engineer skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Health and Safety Engineers succeed in their work:

  • Creativity
  • Analytical skills
  • Great communication skills

What are some common questions about Health and Safety Engineers?

Q: How long does it take to become a safety engineer?

A: About 4 years for entry-level positions!
